title: Pseudo-—Ålass
description: The Pseudo-class in CSS is a type of selector that specifies a special state of the selected elements, such as `:hover` or `:nth-child(n)`.
content: The selector that targets elements based on their state or position in the document. Pseudo-classes start with a colon and can style elements like links when hovered or form fields when disabled, adding dynamic styling based on user interaction or document structure.
